definition: Chen Zi'ang (c. 661-702), Tang dynasty poet
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive

sentences.english: Chen Ziang is one of the most outstanding prose writers in the Sui, Tang and Five Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 陳子昂是隋唐五代巴蜀最優秀的散文家之一。

sentences.english: Following Chen Ziang, He Zhizhang is the only one who take the responsibility of the reformation of poem style.
sentences.chinese: 繼陳子昂之後，他是自覺地承擔起詩風改革的又一人。

definition: Qian Qi (c. 710-780), Tang Dynasty poet
Zeng Gong (1019-1083), Song dynasty writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
Wei Yinwu (737-792), Tang dynasty poet
Liu Yuxi (772-842), Tang poet
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
Qi of Southern dynasties (479-502)
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
historian from Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋, author of History of Eastern Han 後漢書|后汉书
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
Zhang Ji (767-830), Tang Dynasty poet
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
